page.title: 13The Canal And Waterworks.
page.content: The other day we went down to the waterworks which is the Brindley Bank Pumping Station. We use the water for drinking, in other words it is a water supply. From 1905 until 1968 the water was pumped by a steam engine but now it is pumped by electricity. The bore hole is about 165m deep down under the earth. The Trent and Mersey Canal is used for pleasure. It is used for boating and fishing and there is a tow path for walking on. The Bloody Steps, which go down to the canal, are called that because in 1839 Christina Collins was murdered on a boat. Her body was found next morning in the canal. Her body was carried to Rugeley up the steps. So from that day on we call the steps 'The Bloody Steps'.The men who murdered her were either transported to Australia or hung and Christina Collins is buried in Rugeley.
